descriptionProfile: National Geographic Photographer // Filmmaker // Public Speaker // Sony Artisan // Fan of wild places and wild things || San Antonio Texas 5.3.17
National Geographic Photographer // Filmmaker // Public Speaker // Sony Artisan // Fan of wild places and wild things || San Antonio Texas 5.3.17

posts.description: The edge of shrinking, frozen world: Today many of my friends and colleagues are marching for science. I‚Äôve spent years working on the front lines of climate change seeing rivers dry, glaciers dwindle and our frozen realms shrink.  The science explaining this rapid rate of change is agreed upon by 97% of planets scientific leaders and yes, we are playing a hand in it, all of us, myself included. It shouldn‚Äôt be political though.  It should simply be a call to change, to find solutions and innovations together to protect this beautiful blue sphere we all share. Thanks for the leadership @jeremyjones @protectourwinters #climatechange #climatemarch #antarctica #scienceisreal #keepparis #noplanetb üì∑ @pedromcbride
Above the urban canyons of New York City - working on a film about a canyon far far away. Inspired by work at TriBeCa film fest and film by  @perrip08 #newyork #chasingrivers #aerial #sonyalpha

Hi Mom and Dad - the nice folks in Ohio @vtadayton say hi. I just finished a whirl of talks in Omaha, Stanford and ended my 35th #chasingrivers talk for @natgeo live last night in Dayton to a warm crowd of over 1000. It has been an honor to be a visual voice for rivers, fresh water and wild landscapes - all of which are huge economic engines -  but are sadly often neglected or even pitted at war with our economy.
Earth Day was yesterday -- It seems to me, with only one home, we should celebrate it more than once a year.  #noplanetb

Happy üåç Day! To celebrate, and remember how remarkable this planet is that we all share, you can get a signed print just today at  @natgeocreative photo sale by 22 @natgeo photographers. The images in this collection were shot by my colleagues: @johnstanmeyer @stevewinterphoto @coryrichards @cristinamittermeier @jimrichardsonng @argonautphoto @dguttenfelder @anniegriffithsphotography @timlaman @joelsartore. I'm honored to have an an aerial image from Iceland in this sale that ends today. To learn more, go to the link in my bio. #conservation #earthday #climatechange #tiger #orangutan #himalaya #buffalo #wildlife #volcano #native #aerial

Grand Layers: Excited to speak about Western water and this layered world of rock, wind and time tonight at @stanford Bing theater in honor of #earthday. #grandcanyon #chasingrivers  #nature #gratitude #humility #coloradoriver #stanfordlive

Just two days left in this @natgeocreative flash sale showcasing work by @natgeo photographers. You can purchase these signed prints until this Saturday - Earth Day. This small collection here of the 22 available prints by: @chamiltonjames  @daviddoubilet  @ladzinski  @paulnicklen @jenniferhayesig. Check out the profiles of these amazing shooters that I feel fortunate to call friends.  Honored my image -- aerial river delta above Iceland -- gets to grace this collection which was created to raise funds for #conservation around Earth Day. Learn more at the link in my bio.  #earthday #grizzly #underwater #tetons #aerial #iceland #seal

In honor of Earth Day, I'm delighted to have my work a part of the @natgeocreative flash sale showcasing remarkable imagery from my colleagues, mentors and friends at @natgeo. The sale offers signed prints this week only. To learn more, go to the link in bio. This small sampling of stunning images are by @randyolson @amytoensing @brianskerry @amivitale  #earthday #flashsale #nature #wildlife #panda #whale #lightning #crane

Above Iceland: In honor of earth day, you can buy this signed print and other remarkable shots from my colleagues @natgeo @natgeocreative. Prints are only $100 with a quarter of the proceeds going to further science, conservation and exploration work on our beautiful blue planet that we all share. Go to the link in my bio to learn more. Sale ends April 22. Volcanic 'dragon' delta greeting the sea. #earthday #iceland #aerial #gratitude #nature #chasingrivers üì∑@pedromcbride @sonyalpha

Story of two Bugs: My cool niece Riley ‚ÄúBug‚Äù learned to drive yesterday in the exact same car I learned in ‚Äî a 1973 VW Bug. (The pillow helped her reach the pedals). Great to spend time with family over Easter. #happyeaster #family #colorado #gratitude

Misty foothills and a holy river - Ma Ganga, the Ganges. Excited to talk about this winding 1500-mile long  lifeline that sustains 500 million people. I'll also address other majestic waterways next Tuesday to a live audience in Omaha Nebraska for #natgeolive.  Come join us. #chasingrivers #holyunholyriver #india #ganges #aerial

Lurking below: Swimming inside ‚Äúshark city‚Äù made me terrified, but now I am fearful for sharks. These apex predators play a key role in maintaining healthy reef ecosystems, but reef sharks rarely see fishing restrictions. This over fishing combined with coral bleaching due to warming seas, are creating a severe decline in shark populations. To learn more about the challenges our seas face and the solutions, check out the work of my friends Paul and Cristina at @sea_legacy #sharks #climatechange #underwater #tuamotus #fisheries #nature

Endangered Landscapes: For those in the Bay Area, I‚Äôm excited to share stories at Stanford University April 21 about my 800-mile photographic odyssey through the Grand Canyon,  Colorado River landscapes and the challenges they all face. More info in bio link.
For many Navajo, Hopi,  canyon lovers and others, this image is a sacred landscape, a natural church, believed to be best left for nature. For others, it is the best place for a 1.4-mile-long tramway into the heart of the Grand Canyon, carrying up to 10,000 people a day.  The economics and philosophy of this proposal, have divided the Navajo nation around it which is planning a vote on the project ‚Äúsoon‚Äù. Native Navajo Jason Nez, standing in the image, is fighting to keep the landscape undeveloped, but he is also acutely aware of the economic drought his nation faces. He wants to find economic alternatives. #chasingrivers #grandcanyon #nature #navajo #confluence üì∑#petemcbride thx for support  @hyperlite_mountain_gear @goalzero @4cornerfilmlogistics @delormegps

Amazon by foot: Once upon a time, my friend @ed_stafford spent over a year walking the length of the Amazon River ‚Äî a mind boggling 4345-mile journey. Why? Well, because it the world‚Äôs longest river and such a journey by foot had never been done. How he did it is another question. All I know is I got to follow him for a couple weeks through inky, mysterious waters, nervous about what lurked below. Despite a close encounter with a 10-foot electric eel, little happened beyond a few hundred bug bites, lots of thorns and some blisters. #MattPower, the talented writer that joined me (left of image), tragically passed away on another story walking another river, the Nile. I miss his joyous laughter and remarkable fearlessness daily. #amazonriver #archive #chasingrivers #nature #adventure üì∑@pedromcbride

Reflections on the world of water. In all my travels, water is life -- and lately a concern. In Northern Kenya, water comes from the glacier outflow of 17,000 ft. Mt. Kenya. But today, a changing climate has dwindled 16 glaciers to just over one ‚Äî changing the patterns or runoff to either flood or drought which has stressed the lives of many including the Samburu Tribe, pastoralists that depend on tracking scarce water supplies. I‚Äôm honored  to give the keynote talk for @nature_org at the botanical gardens in Dallas Texas sharing my decade of work around freshwater. Thx @sararacamp & @grownandsewn for duds. #kenya #samburu #freshwater #sarara #nature #climatechange üì∑#petemcbride

Window to water: On our 800-mile journey though the Grand Canyon,  the hunt for water drove everything from our movements to even our moods. Slot canyons often became the best options to drop back to the river ‚Äî that lifeline of the American West.  #grandcanyon #coloradoriver #chasingrivers #sonyalpha

Angling over the Empire.  Having spent years exploring remote, wild canyons, it was a treat to do aerial work above New York City last week for @smithsonianmagazine and see the canyons of the Big Apple from this lofty vantage. The aerial perspective so eloquently illustrates where we have been, and on rare occasions, where we haven‚Äôt. #empirestatebuilding #aerial #newyorkcity #nyc üì∑#petemcbride
